qas.question: What constituency did MP Michael Foot represent?
What position was Michael Foot noted to occupy in government?
What notable piece of legislation did Michael Foot contribute to?

answers.text: 1974 Health and Safety at Work Act

qas.question: What party did Michael Foot become a leader of?
In what town was Michael Foot born?

context: In 1945, <a4_0>Plymouth<a4_0/>-born Michael Foot was elected <a3_0>Labour<a3_0/> MP for the war-torn constituency of <a0_0>Plymouth Devonport<a0_0/> and after serving as <a1_0>Secretary of State for Education<a1_0/> and responsible for the <a2_0>1974 Health and Safety at Work Act<a2_0/>, went on to become one of the most distinguished leaders of the Labour party.
